com.gfb.test

Class QRBill

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gfb.test.QRBill

  • public class QRBill
extends java.lang.Object

    Swiss Payments Code Serializer

    This class was designed to be a bare bones serializer for the Swiss Payments Code, which is meant to adapt the payment system in Switzerland and Liechtenstein to the international ISO 20022 standard. For more information on this please consult the PaymentStandards.ch site, as the implementation guide here was the basis for this class.

    This class was purposely written using only core Java and without any imports, so that it can more easily adapted to other languages and platforms. As such it does not implement Serializable, out of the box, but will do so if simply added. It is designed, not only to serialize, but also to validate data according to the above standard.

    Since:
    2018-05-19
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Gaddo F Benedetti

    • Constructor Detail

      • QRBill

        public QRBill()
        Constructor that generates a partially empty QR Billing object, calling for strict validation and a number of default values. These values are:
        • QR Type Identifier: QRTYPE_SPC
        • Version:
        • Character Set: CODING_LATIN_1
        • Reference Type: REFTYPE_NON
        • Amount: None
        • Currency: CURRENCY_CHF

      • QRBill

        public QRBill(boolean strict)
        Constructor that generates a partially empty QR Billing object, with a number of default values. These values are:
        • QR Type Identifier: QRTYPE_SPC
        • Version:
        • Character Set: CODING_LATIN_1
        • Reference Type: REFTYPE_NON
        • Amount: None
        • Currency: CURRENCY_CHF
        Parameters:
        strict - Boolean. Whether validation should be strict or not. If set to false, various constraints, such as field length, are ignored, although validation will still occur.

      • QRBill

        public QRBill(java.lang.String rawData)
       throws QRBill.QRBillException
        Constructor that generates a QR Billing object, calling for strict validation and using raw QR Bill data as input.
        Parameters:
        rawData - String. Basic QR Bill data. Fields should be separated by new lines. An implementation guide on the format may be found at http://www.paymentstandards.ch/
        Throws:
        QRBill.QRBillException - Thrown when validation fails. Exception message gives a description of the validation error.

      • QRBill

        public QRBill(java.lang.String rawData,
              boolean strict)
       throws QRBill.QRBillException
        Constructor that generates a QR Billing object, using raw QR Bill data as input.
        Parameters:
        rawData - String. Basic QR Bill data. Fields should be separated by new lines. An implementation guide on the format may be found at http://www.paymentstandards.ch/
        strict - Boolean. Whether validation should be strict or not. If set to false, various constraints, such as field length, are ignored, although validation will still occur.
        Throws:
        QRBill.QRBillException - Thrown when validation fails. Exception message gives a description of the validation error.

        public java.lang.String getVersion()
        Gets the QR Bill version number.
        Returns:
        String. The QR Bill version number as a 4-character numerical string, with leading zeros. The first two represent the major version, the second two represent the minor version (e.g. "0100" corresponds to version 1.0).

      • getAlternativeSchema

        public java.lang.String[] getAlternativeSchema()
        Gets all Alternative Schemas.
        Returns:
        String Array. If unprocessed, a string array of up to two String elements, denoting the two lines as presented in the QR code will be returned.

      • getAlternativeSchema

        public java.lang.String[] getAlternativeSchema(int index)
        Gets a specified Alternative Schema.
        Parameters:
        index - Integer. The index being entered - either 0 or 1. Any other value will return all schemas unprocessed (see below) as a two element String array.
        Returns:
        String Array. If processed a string array beginning with the two-character schema identifier as the first element, the single-character deliminator as the second and subsequent elements will be the individual schema data, processed using the deliminator. If unprocessed, a string array of up to two String elements, denoting the two lines as presented in the QR code will be returned.

      • getDueDate

        public int[] getDueDate()
        Gets the due date, if available.
        Returns:
        Integer Array. Three-element array, giving the year, month and day, in that order. If no value is available, null is returned.

      • setQrType

        public boolean setQrType(java.lang.String qrType)
        Sets the QR Type Identifier used. Required for a valid QR Bill.
        Parameters:
        qrType - String. The QR Type Identifier. Possible values: QRTYPE_SPC
        Returns:
        Boolean. Whether the value has validated and stored correctly or not.

      • setVersion

        public boolean setVersion(java.lang.String version)
        Sets the QR Bill version number. Required for a valid QR Bill.
        Parameters:
        version - String. The QR Bill version number as a 4-character numerical string, with leading zeros. The first two represent the major version, the second two represent the minor version (e.g. "0100" corresponds to version 1.0).
        Returns:
        Boolean. Whether the value has validated and stored correctly or not.

        Returns:
        Boolean. Whether the value has validated and stored correctly or not.

        Sets the IBAN used. Required for a valid QR Bill.
        Parameters:
        iban - String. A valid IBAN. Maximum length of 21 characters.
        Returns:
        Boolean. Whether the value has validated and stored correctly or not.

        public boolean setAmount()
        Sets the amount payable to empty - the same as setting it to a value of -1.
        Returns:
        Boolean. Whether the value has validated and stored correctly or not.

      • setAmount

        public boolean setAmount(float amt)
        Sets the amount payable.
        Parameters:
        amt - Float. The amount payable as a float, accurate to two decimal places. If a value of -1 is used then the amount payable will be set as empty.
        Returns:
        Boolean. Whether the value has validated and stored correctly or not.

      • setDueDate

        public boolean setDueDate(int year,
                          int month,
                          int day)
        Sets the due date of the QR bill.
        Parameters:
        year - Integer. The year, as 4-digit number.
        month - Integer. The month, as a number between 1 (January) and 12 (December).
        day - Integer. The month day.
        Returns:
        Boolean. Always returns true, even if the value is not stored.

      • setReference

        public boolean setReference()
        Sets the reference type as REFTYPE_NON, wuth an empty reference.
        Returns:
        Always returns true.

      • setReference

        public boolean setReference(java.lang.String refType,
                            java.lang.String ref)
        Sets the reference type and reference itslef.
        Parameters:
        refType - String. The currency of the amount payable. Possible values: REFTYPE_QRR, REFTYPE_SCOR, REFTYPE_NON
        ref - String. The reference. In the case of REFTYPE_QRR and REFTYPE_SCOR, this must represent valid QRR and SCOR references, of maximum 27 annd 25 characters lengths respectively. For REFTYPE_NON, this value will be ignored and the reference left empty.
        Returns:
        Boolean. Whether the value has validated and stored correctly or not.

      • setAdditionalInfo

        public boolean setAdditionalInfo(java.lang.String info)
        Sets the additional information field.
        Parameters:
        info - String. The text of the additional information. Maximum length of 140 characters.
        Returns:
        Boolean. Whether the value has validated and stored correctly or not.

      • setAlternativeSchema

        public boolean setAlternativeSchema(java.lang.String data,
                                    int index)
        Stores and validates an inputted Alternative Schema in up to two lines. The first two characters of the first/only line should be an identifier for the schema, the third character will be treated as the delineator for the rest of the string data. Due to the ambiguity of implementation guide as well as the apparent error in the example in the same document, clarification was sought on how this data is handled. From this response we can say the following:
        • Up to two alternate schemas may exist, each taking up a single line in the QR code. An alternate schema entry is not mandatory.
        • Each alternate schemas entry may be up to 100 characters in length.
        Parameters:
        data - String. The alternative schema data as two entries. Maximum length of each entry is 100 characters, no maximum length is specified for the second. If null the entry is cleared.
        index - Integer. The index being entered - either 0 or 1.
        Returns:
        Boolean. Always returns true as, even if not set, the field is not mandatory.

      • setAlternativeSchema

        public boolean setAlternativeSchema(java.lang.String[] data)
        Stores and validates an inputted Alternative Schema in up to two lines. The first two characters of the first/only line should be an identifier for the schema, the third character will be treated as the delineator for the rest of the string data. Due to the ambiguity of implementation guide as well as the apparent error in the example in the same document, clarification was sought on how this data is handled. From this response we can say the following:
        • Up to two alternate schemas may exist, each taking up a single line in the QR code. An alternate schema entry is not mandatory.
        • Each alternate schemas entry may be up to 100 characters in length.
        Parameters:
        data - data String Array. The alternative schema data as an array. Maximum length of each entry is 100 characters, no maximum length is specified for the second. If the array only contains one element then this is assigned as the first and the second is cleared. If the array contains more than two elements then all elements after the second are ignored. If null all entries are cleared.
        Returns:
        Boolean. Always returns true as, even if not set, the field is not mandatory.

      • setAlternativeSchema

        public boolean setAlternativeSchema()
        Clears the Alternative Schema entries.
        Returns:
        Boolean. Always returns true as, even if not set, the field is not mandatory.

      • setActor

        public boolean setActor(int typeId,
                        java.lang.String name,
                        java.lang.String street,
                        java.lang.String housenumber,
                        java.lang.String postalcode,
                        java.lang.String location,
                        java.lang.String country)
        Sets an actor associated with the QR Bill. An actor is one of several legal entities affected by the QR Bill, namely the creditor, ultimate creditor or ultimate debtor.
        Parameters:
        typeId - Integer. The actor type. Possible values: ACTOR_CR, ACTOR_UCR, ACTOR_UDR
        name - String. Mandatory. Maximum length of 70 characters. The actor full name.
        street - String. Optional. Maximum length of 70 characters. The actor street address.
        housenumber - String. Optional. Maximum length of 16 characters. The actor house number.
        postalcode - String. Optional. Maximum length of 16 characters. The actor post code.
        location - String. Mandatory. Maximum length of 35 characters. The actor location, such as town or city.
        country - String. Mandatory. Maximum length of 2 characters. The actor country, given as a 2-letter country code (ISO 3166-1).
        Returns:
        Boolean. Whether the value has validated and stored correctly or not.
